column4: synaptic will tell me the location in my file system where KDE 4 is installed to?
i'm running kde 4 right this second
i need to know where kde base is installed in
it's not in /opt, it's not in /sbin
you can use dpkg to list files part of the KDE4 package, is that is what you want?
how do i use dpkg to list files part of KDE4 packages?
ty ty, that's exactly what I needed
for all kde packages - for i in $(dpkg -l | grep -i kde4 | cut -c 3-30); do dpkg -L $i; done
yeah, i just did $ dpkg -L kdebase[auto complete]
well, that only lists files of that one package tho, which is what i was getting at.
kde[autocomplete] shows all the packages that begin with kde
dpkg -l | grep -i kde4 | cut -c 3-30 is pretty sophisticated, more than i need
